data.title: JavaScript syntax highlighting
Returning a object literal CompletionList stalls intellisense
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  write an extension that implements a CompletionItemProvider
2. In the provider return a CompletionList, but instead of creating it with
`new CompletionList(items)` create a literal that has the same form:

``` typescript
        let result: CompletionList = {
            items: items,
            isIncomplete: false
        };
```

All compiles fine, but when invoking, the suggest widget gets stuck on 'Pending'.
No errors in the console.

-> Either allow that object literals that have the shape of a CompletionList can also be passed, or create an error in the extension host when the returned result is neither a CompletionItem[] and not instance of a CompletionList.
Given that the compiler doesn't enforce you to create a CompletionList with the constructor I'm for the first one (The language server also does that).

data.title: Align Format behavior across languages
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0 alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10 / Ubuntu 15.10

Using format code in Javascript does not remove extra blank lines at the bottom of the file. In other languages format code removes these extra lines.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a Javascript file
2. Add new lines to the end of the file
3. Format code

Try the same with a JSON or HTML file.

What is the expected behavior of using format code with blank lines at the end of the file?

Maybe check that env.licenseUrl does not point to https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/LICENSE.txt also?

data.title: Cannot read property 'identifier' of undefined
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 (version 1511, build 10586.218)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Use Node.js (I'm using 4.4.0 right now)
2. Type "typeof" in a JavaScript file. 

Seems to always pop up when while I'm typing an if statement and haven't added the variable I'm trying to get the typeof. Not a huge issue but results in a VSCode error popping up that I then have to close.

Developer tools shows: 

```
    Cannot read property 'identifier' of undefined
    e.doShow @ workbench.main.js:90
```

Great work on VSCode though! Really enjoying it. :+1:

data.title: Snippets: Translate all tab characters (not just leading) to spaces

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

With VS Code option: "editor.insertSpaces": set to true, snippets only translate \t characters to spaces when they are at the beginning of the string.

Following snippet correctly translates \t character to spaces:

   "If statement": {
      "prefix": "if",
      "body": [
         "if ${true}",
         "\t$0",
         "end-if"
      ]
   }

Following snippet incorrectly leaves \t as a tab character:

   "If statement": {
      "prefix": "if",
      "body": [
         "if ${true}",
         "_\t$0",
         "end-if"
      ]
   }

data.title: No 24/7 inteli-sense in css comments
data.body:
- VSCode Version: alpha
- OS Version: os x

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open a css file, start writing a comment
2. notice that the 24/7 intelli-sense is always in your face, it is quite frustrating

I know that for .js we do not show 24/7 intelli-sense inside comments, I would like the same for other premium languages we have, e.g css.

data.title: Release/1.0.0
Disable automatic highlighting of current token/word?
data.body:
Sorry if this has been asked before (I couldn't find it in any issues containing "highlight").

Is it possible to disable automatic highlighting of the current token/word without also disabling match-highlight for explicit selections via `"editor.selectionHighlight": false`?

Thanks!
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0-insider
- OS Version: Win10

- OS Version: Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In the vscode repo open /vscode/extensions/php as folder
2. set a breakpoint on /src/features/hoverProvider.ts, line 13 (in provideHover)
3. F5 to run the extension
4. in the dev target open a PHP file and hover over a word
5. Debugger stops, but call stack stays empty

data.title: Inconsistency between license in Github and installer
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0
- OS Version: Windows

In LICENSE file it says that VS Code is licensed under MIT. However, when installing it, you have to agree to a completely different license, which says that you can't not only "reverse engineer, decompile or disassemble the software" but also "share, publish, or lend the software". In my opinion it quite contradicts the MIT license:

> Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy of this software and associated documentation
> files (the "Software"), to deal in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights to use, copy,
> modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software
> is furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:
> 
> The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all copies or substantial portions of the Software.
> 
> THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED _AS IS_, WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES
> OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS
> BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM, OUT
> OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE SOFTWARE.

Should it be like that or is it a mistake?

![installation screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6719472/14562761/3dcc5700-0327-11e6-978b-ac3223631d8b.png)

data.title: Small nit in JS docs
data.body:
on https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/languages/javascript it says

..." all you need is that the typings folder is a sibling or child of the jsconfig.json file to get IntelliSense"

files do NOT have children, only folders. Makes it a bit difficult to parse.

data.title: "There are no updates currently available"
data.body:
Hi. I'm using Visual Studio Code 0.10.8 on Windows 7. I just read [version 1.0.0 has been released](https://code.visualstudio.com/Updates#_100-march-2016) but when I try Help / Check for updates nothing happens. Eventually I get a message "There are no updates currently available" 

I'm in an office network behind a proxy. Perhaps Code can't access the internet. If so, it would be better to give a more accurate message "could not connect to check for updates, here's a link to check for updates yourself"

data.title: Sash double clicks
data.body:
- [x] win @alexandrudima 
- [x] mac @chrisdias 
- [x] linux @aeschli

You can now double click on the sash to resize it
- for the explorer sash, verify that the sidebar gets large enough to show you the file names without trimming
- for other viewlets the behaviour is to size the sidebar to its minimum allowed size
- for the panel as well
- for the diff editor it will size it equally (50, 50)
- when you have multiple editors open, it will size the two editors around a sash with half of the available width

data.title: New command to open a folder for extension writers
data.body:
- [x] win @jrieken 
- [x] mac @isidorn 
- [x] linux @waderyan 

We introduced a new command that is exposed to extensions to open a folder in the same or new window
- the command identifier is `vscode.openFolder` and it accepts two optional arguments `uri` and `newWindow`
- if you ommit the `uri` to open, it is also possible to bring up the native file dialog to let the user make the decision

data.title: Typings are not available with ES6 module system
TextEditor argument passed by onDidChangeActiveTextEditor is null
data.body:
A new [issue](https://github.com/shardulm94/vscode-trailingspaces/issues/4) was logged for my extension from the vscode telemetry which showed that the TextEditor argument for onDidChangeActiveTextEditor was null. Can you highlight any scenarios in which the argument can be null?

I checked untitled editors and preview editors (e.g. markdown preview), they don't pass a null TextEditor.

data.title: [json] swagger 2.0 json schema not working for intellisense in visual studio code
Official download at https://code.visualstudio.com/license has bogus, lengthy legalese additional license although project is easily available under MIT here
data.body:
Official download at https://code.visualstudio.com/license has bogus, lengthy legalese additional license although project appears to be easily available under just the much shorter MIT licensing from here. This is shady behavior and encourages people to make unofficial packages which do exactly the same but risk incompatibilities just to escape the useless waste of additional legalese terms to agree to.

Why not just make the official version be exactly under the MIT license, and then just offer _optional_ feedback features that don't require ten pages of additional terms to agree to?? That's just silly.
